results.title: Enemy of the State
results.creator_credit: Tony Scott, Jerry Bruckheimer, Scott Free Productions and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: In this action thriller from director Tony Scott, Will Smith plays Robert Clayton Dean, an innocent everyman who gets caught up in espionage, murder and government corruption. When Robert is handed a tape with damning evidence, he discovers there is no hiding from the insidious technology that tracks his every move. Robert seeks the aid of former covert operative Brill - Gene Hackman in a role that references his iconic Harry Caul from key 1970s paranoid thriller “The Conversation”. Cast also includes Jon Voight, Gabriel Byrne, Jason Robards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Scott, Jerry Bruckheimer, Scott Free Productions and Touchstone Pictures

results.title: Cool runnings
results.creator_credit: Jon Turteltaub, Dawn Steel and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: The world was shocked when Jamaica entered the Winter Olympics with a bobsled team. Although they don’t win gold, the four Jamaicans become heroes for their courage and determination to compete with the world’s best. John Candy plays the ex-Olympian, once accused of cheating, who acts as their coach. Based on a true story “Cool Runnings” repeats the ageless Disney film message about following your dreams.

results.title: Blank check
results.creator_credit: Rupert Wainwright, Gary Adelson, Craig Baumgarten and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: When 11-year-old Preston Waters’ bicycle is hit by a crook on the run, a hastily scrawled blank cheque sets the wheels in motion for the spending spree of a lifetime. Cast includes Brian Bonsall, Karen Duffy, Miguel Ferrer.

results.title: Hey babe
results.creator_credit: Rafal Zielinski, Arthur Voronka, Institut Quebecois, Canadian Film Development Corporation and Rafal Productions
results.brief_description: Starstruck 12-year-old Theresa (Yasmine Bleeth), a streetwise orphan, is determined to find fame and success in the show-business industry but it is not until she meets up with Buddy (Buddy Hackett), an aging vaudeville performer, that her dream finally becomes reality. Cast also includes Marushka Stankova, Vlasta Vrana, Denise Proulx.

results.title: Little Johnny Jones
results.creator_credit: Gary Halvorson, Bill Siegler, Showtime Entertainment and Group W Cable Productions
results.brief_description: This Goodspeed Opera House production of George M. Cohan’s classic American musical “Little Johnny Jones” is performed on stage in front of a live audience and features such hit songs as “Yankee Doodle Dandy” and “Give my regards to Broadway”. The cast includes Eric Weitz as Johnny Jones and Peter Van Norden as Anthony Anstey, with Lenny Wolpe, Ernie Sabella, Bruce Chew, Jack Bittner, Maureen Brennan, Anna Mcneely, Jane Galloway. Book, music and lyrics by George M. Cohan adapted by Alfred Uhry and stage direction by Gerald Gutierrez.

results.title: Yes, Giorgio
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Peter Fetterman, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy about an opera singer who loses his voice, the beautiful doctor who helps him find it, and the love affair which results. Includes an extensive segment from the opera, Turandot. Stars Luciano Pavarotti as Giorgio, Kathryn Harrold and Eddie Albert. Original music composed and conducted by Michael J. Lewis. Contains some scenes in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: This is the army
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Hal B. Wallis, Jack L. Warner, Thirtieth Cemalux, Hollywood House Video and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In World War I dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the War, he becomes a producer. In World War II his son Johnny Jones, previously his father’s assistant, gets the order to stage a new all-soldier show, called “This is the army”. But in his personal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiance until the war is over. Cast includes George Murphy, Joan Leslie, George Tobias, Alan Hale, Kate Smith, and men from the armed forces including Ronald Reagan and Joe Louis. Based on the play by Irving Berlin, music and lyrics by Irving Berlin. Includes bonus blooper footage of Ronald Reagan in rehearsal. Note: “Copyright Thirtieth Cemalux Pty Ltd 1986”

results.title: The Pajama game
results.creator_credit: Stanley Donen, George Abbott and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A musical comedy about a pajama factory worker and her co-workers fight to get a 7.1/2 cents pay raise that is being fought by their employers. Cast includes Doris Day, John Raitt, Carol Haney and Eddie Foy Jr, with music and lyrics by Richard Adler and Jerry Ross, and choreography by Bob Fosse. Based upon the book “7.1/2 cents” by Richard Bissell and the play “The Pajama game” by George Abbott and Richard Bissell. Screenplay by George Abbott and Richard Bissell.

results.title: Mighty Joe Young
results.creator_credit: Ernest B Schoedsack, Merian C. Cooper, John Ford, RKO Radio Pictures, Arko Productions and Argosy Pictures
results.brief_description: Following in the footsteps of King Kong, this is a fantasy story about another giant ape by the name of Joe Young, his devoted owner Jill Young (Terry Moore) and the exploitation Joe Young suffers when he is taken from his native country of Africa back to America and the bright lights of Hollywood. Cast also includes Ben Johnson and Robert Armstrong.

constellations_other.name: Sublime light and special effects
constellations_other.description: Explore 19th-century artist John Martin’s surprising influence on science fiction and fantasy films of the 20th century, from Jason and the Argonauts to the Lord of the Rings and the Evil Dead franchises.

results.title: Crimson tide
results.creator_credit: Tony Scott, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Two military men from different eras collide when their submarine is engaged in possible nuclear warfare. Gene Hackman plays an old-school captain, fearsome to his staff and a stickler for rules; Denzel Washington plays Lt. Commander Ron Hunter, a Harvard graduate who believes preventing conflict is also the role of the armed forces. As these two face off over the possibility of war, tensions, egos and threats soar. Cast also includes James Gandolfini and Matt Craven.
